answerText: Cosmic Scale Factor (or Robertson-Walker scale factor)[10] The square of the scale factor appears in front of the spacelike dimensions in this metric which describes a flat but expanding universe.
heading: DEES |2014 | WUSTL  | 10 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The acceleration of the expansion of the universe means that this quantity's second derivative is positive, and the Hubble constant is this variable's time derivative over itself.  [10] Name this parameter that measures the distance between two things in the universe as a function of time.
